episode_title: 519 - The One Where Ross Can’t Flirt

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is getting ready for a date with Monica as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! You look nice. What’s the occasion?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica and I are celebrating our ten-month anniversary, we’ve got reservations at Ja George.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! How’d you get in there?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Made a few calls, pulled some strings, and they agreed to seat us at 11:30 if we both had the chicken and didn’t get desert.
(There’s a knock on the door and Chandler answers it. It’s the pizza delivery girl.)

content.speaker: Delivery Girl
content.text: Hi Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Caitlin! Somebody got a haircut.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Ugh, I hate it! I look like an 8-year-old boy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, if that was true, gym class would’ve been a lot more interesting.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: It’s uh, 27 dollars even.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, okay. (Hands her the money.) Here you go.
(The duck starts quacking.)

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Hey, where’s the chicken?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, he’s in the back. The duck pissed him off, said that eggs came first.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Great. I’ll see you later!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, bye!
(He closes the door and turns to see Ross glaring at him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What the hell was that?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The flirting! Aren’t you supposed to be going out with, I don’t know hmm, let’s say my sister?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was not flirting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was totally flirting. “Somebody got a haircut (Makes some whiney, nasally noises.)”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay first of all, the impression, uncanny. And second, that was not flirting, that was just casual conversation between two people. That is all.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You wanna see flirting? I’ll show you flirting. (Starts to move towards Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m good.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel and Phoebe are in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am so proud of Joey, I can’t believe he’s going to be on Law & Order !

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know. But don’t you think that it should be called Order and Law?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No because first they arrest the guy and then they try him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t get me started on that.
(Ross and Chandler enter with the pizzas.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was not flirting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And on your anniversary, for shame!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler was hitting on the hot delivery girl!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was not and oh God, shh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I’m sorry but you were! Okay? And besides if anyone should be hitting on her it’s the guy who’s single, the guy that who-who-who can do something about it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sounds like somebody wants to be Mr. Pizza Delivery Girl.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is that what this is about? You like Caitlin?
(Ross looks at Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! We broke up two years ago; you’ve been married since then. I think it’s okay that we see other people.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I-I was watching her the other day at the pizza place.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hm-mmm.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And she’s just so sexy and funny and has the cutest little…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, y’know what? We don’t need her measurements.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay pepperoni, pepperoni, pepperoni, okay Ross, I know she’s pretty and you love her, but is she stupid?! She forgot my vegetarian!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is perfect! She’ll have to come back here with your pizza, and when she does, I’ll turn on the Charm-O-Ross. Oh I’m so glad you don’t eat meat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See? Vegetarianism benefits everyone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey everybody, look who’s here! You remember my grandmother!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Big night!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is so cool!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, Joey on Law & Order , you must be very proud!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, she doesn’t understand a word of English.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry, I thought you were Joey’s other grandmother. (She just stares at him.) I’ve done it again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She’s my biggest fan. Yeah, she’s the only one in the family that’s believed in me.

(They both start speaking Italian to each other, and since I’m not Italian and don’t understand one word, we’ll move on to the English portion of the show. Not, that I’m English. Not that there’s anything wrong with that, it’s just that I’m not. Y’know I think I should shut-up now and move on. Anyhoo, she says something about Joey being fat I think based on this line.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I uh weighted like 27 pounds when I was born so…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! Happy Anniversary!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Happy Anniversary, 10 months! (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So umm, when I was in the shower I was thinking about our first night in London…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhh, Joey’s grandmother is right there. (Points)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is that the one that speaks English or the one that doesn’t?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The one that doesn’t.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was some hot love you gave me! I’m gonna go get ready.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, why don’t you wear those earrings I gave you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s a great idea! I was saving them for something special.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You have got to go home!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But I like it here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You gotta go home and get the earrings that you borrowed from me okay? Chandler wants me to wear them tonight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, well I think that they’re in my purse. Why don’t you go get dressed and I’ll look for them.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! (Walks over to Rachel) Rach, hi, I need those earrings you borrowed.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, umm, okay, yeah, I’ll be, yeah I’ll be right back. (Goes to her room.)

(Phoebe then gets possessed ’cause she starts speaking in tongues. She speaks Italian to Joey’s grandmother. She is quickly exorcised and returns to speaking in English. Of course, too most people English is a strange language as well. But none of them are probably reading this and if they were they wouldn’t understand it. So why am I talking about them? I have absolutely no clue. Moving on…)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow Pheebs, you speak Italian?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I guess so. (See, the brief possession didn’t affect her at all, like we could really tell.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here you go. Thank you!
content.parenthetical: She enters and hands Phoebe the earring

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, Rach! Where’s the other one?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh what, you-you want both of them?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel Karen Green, where’s the other earring?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, okay, okay, look, just don’t freak out, but I kinda lost it. I know it’s in the apartment, but I definitely lost it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, what am I going to tell Monica? She wants to wear them tonight!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Tell her to wear her own earrings.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: These are her earrings.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nooo! Nooooo! You lent me Monica’s earrings?! I’m not allowed to borrow her stuff!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because I lose her stuff!

[Time Lapse, the gang is now watching Law & Order. By the way, the entire rest of the episode takes place in Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Why are they called apartments when they’re all stuck together? Something to think about.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, see that blind guy right there? I’m gonna bash his head in later.
(His grandmother asks him something.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh umm, my big scene is coming up. Big scene coming up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If you said, “Big lima bean, bubbling up.” Would she understand the difference?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach? What are you doing?
content.parenthetical: noticing Rachel crawling behind the couch

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh boy, I just can’t watch. It’s too scary!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s a diaper commercial.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah well, you know me, babies, responsibilities, ahhh!!!
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Pizza delivery!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ll get it! I will get that! (Runs over and opens the door.)

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: One uh, vegetarian pizza. That’s $12.15.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. Uh, by the way, if it makes you feel any better. I happen to like 8-year-old boys.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The uh, your hair, before, your hair, you said you thought your looks like an 8-year-old’s, and I’m just saying I like it. The hair.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Oh. Thanks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You understand I don’t actually like 8-year-old boys.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Y’know, all I’m looking for is the money.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here you go. (Hands her the money.) Now stop bringing us pizzas you.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: I’m gonna try. (Walks away and Ross closes the door.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re welcome.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You couldn’t let me have her, could ya?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is a girl that I really like and had too swoop in there!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s goin’ on?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler was totally flirting with the hot delivery girl!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you for that! (To Monica) I was not flirting.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s okay. I don’t care. It’s uh, it’s fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s no big deal, I do it all the time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So umm, you-you flirt with guys all the time?
content.parenthetical: starts to laugh, but then gets serious

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure! It doesn’t mean anything! Just like I know it doesn’t mean anything with you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but there is a big difference. You are a lot hotter than I am.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: True story! (Goes and sits down.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, this actually bothers you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, it does bother me! And I think it would bother a lot of people. Rachel, when you were going out with Ross, did it bother you when he flirted with other women?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uhh, no, no, it bothered me when he slept with other women.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And thank you, for that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But y’know, I never really had anything to worry about. Ross was never very good at the flirting thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? (Mumbles) What-what, what are talking about? It-it worked with you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Y’know what? You’re right! We meet, you flirted and then bamn nine years later you had me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, all right. You-you-you know what I’m going to do? I am going to order another pizza and when Caitlin gets here, you-you—I will show how well I flirt. Yeah! I will, I will get her phone number! (To Chandler) And not the one on the menu!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I found it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! Thank God! Where was it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: On your dresser.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay that is the one we already have!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, here’s my big scene. My big scene’s here! (They have two of the cops on the street, then they cut to where they’re entering an apartment.) Oh my God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, everybody just keep smiling. It’ll kill my grandmother if she finds out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, what is it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, they cut me out of the show.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe your scene’s coming up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not likely. ’Cause you see that body bag right there

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m in it.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, it’s continued from before the commercial break.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is terrible, what are you going to do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. This little, old lady lives for my career. When they dumped me off of Days of Our Lives she almost died.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s not good.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, smile! Not that face, smile! Everybody smile! (They all smile.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, why don’t you just tell her what happened? It’s not your fault.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If we keep talking this way, aren’t we gonna freak her out soon?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Soon, soon, I’m gonna be on soon. There I am! (Points to the screen, of course it isn’t him.)

content.speaker: Grandma Tribbiani
content.text: No! Sam Waterston!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no, that-that’s me, that’s me.

content.speaker: Grandma Tribbiani
content.text: No, it’s Sam Waterston! Crimes and Misdemeanors , Capricorn One .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Doesn’t know, “Hello.” But she knows Capricorn One .
(Phoebe gets up.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe! I have to have those earrings, we’re going to leave as soon as the show is over.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But I already gave them back to you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No you didn’t.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, I already didn’t give them back to you, that’s what I said. (Walks away over to Rachel.) Where is that other earring?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s not here Pheebs, it’s not here. Ohh, I went to Joey and Chandler’s last night! Okay! (Goes to the door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Make sure you check Chandler’s jewelry box.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait a minute. Chandler has a jewelry box?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, we have like ten minutes. Do you want me to get into that now?!
(Rachel heads for Joey and Chandler’s and Phoebe heads for the kitchen to find Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Pheebs! How’s that uh, vegetarian pizza working out for ya? You and those vegetables have a real thing going on, huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why are you being weird?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do you like it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, that would be, “Why are you being cute?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’m working on my flirting.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! I did not get that.
[Cut to Chandler and Monica on the couch.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So uh Monica, do you, do you like the Law & Order ?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, it’s good.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See, I’m finding out all this stuff about you today, like you like the Law & Order and that you flirted with every guy in the Tri-State area!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! (Joey and his grandmother shush them and wave them away, which they do.) Okay, let me get this straight, it’s okay for you to flirt, but not for me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I’m so glad we cleared that up. Look, I’m sorry, some things are different for men and for women.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Go on, teach me something about men and women.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I’ve already taught you so much already, but whatever. See when you flirt with a guy you think, “I’m just flirting, no big deal.” But the guy is thinking, “Finally! Somebody who wants to sleep with me!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No way!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s true.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well that’s pathetic!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Again true.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And this goes for all guys?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All guys that are awake. Then we go to sleep and then all the guys from the other end of the world wake up and behave the exact same way.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, it’s another commercial; I still haven’t told her!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey! This is like the last commercial. You’ve got like (checks his watch) ten minutes left!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, I know! What am I going to do? (Thinks) Ooh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! You are not gonna run out and leave her here!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, all right. (Thinks of something.) Ooh! (He quickly runs out before anyone can stop him.)

content.speaker: Grandma Tribbiani
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, Joey is gonna be right back. Right back! (Tries to pantomime it for her.) Meanwhile, let’s-let’s-let’s talk about you. (Pause.) So, you’re old and small.
[Time lapse, Rachel is coming back from Chandler and Joey’s.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: (To Phoebe) (whispering) Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Did you find it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The earring? No. But look, I found my sunglasses under the couch! I’ve been looking for these since like last summer. (Puts ’em on.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, those are my sunglasses, you borrowed them from me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, calm down, here they are. (Gives back the sunglasses.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe! (Motions for the earrings. Phoebe gives her the one-minute sign.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are we going to do?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right well, we’re just gonna have to tell Monica, that’s all.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh gosh, she’s going to kill me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I suppose I could tell her it’s just all my fault.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh that’d be great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Mon, can I talk to you for a sec?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, what is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, I lost one of your earrings. I’m sorry! I am so, so sorry!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! All right well, I mean, what can you do? If you lost it you lost it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I will replace it, I promise. I feel so terrible.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, sweetie that’s fine. You didn’t do it on purpose.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look at you! Come here! (They hug.) Feel better?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! You’re the best!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, wait a minute. Wait a minute, I-I-I, I can’t do this. Listen honey, this is, it’s not Phoebe’s fault. She lent me the earrings, and I lost it. I’m so sorry. Honey, I feel terrible too. (Holds out her arms for a hug.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is exactly why I do not lend you stuff!! (Rachel looks over at Phoebe in resignation.) Okay?! I mean, first it’s my jewelry! And if it’s not my jewelry, it’s-it’s my blue sweater! And if it’s not my sweater, it’s my sunglasses!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Your sunglasses?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, right! (Hands Monica back her sunglasses.)

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Pizza!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, mine! Mine! Mine! (to everyone) Okay, here goes. Prepare yourselves for some Class A flirting.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, hold on. (Pauses as he readies himself.) Okay. (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, you have nothing to prove. And if you really like this girl, I don’t flirting is the right thing to… (Ross interrupts and shushes her.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’ll see. Okay. (Readies himself.) Oh, what’s-what’s her name?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Caitlin!

content.speaker: Grandma Tribbiani
content.text: Caitlin!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Oh, we-we can’t keep eating like this. (Monica turns her head in shame.)
content.parenthetical: He opens the door while faking a laugh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, (gets the money) so, do you make the pizzas in one of those uh, wood-burning ovens?

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: No actually umm, I think that they’re umm, gas.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gas? Wow! Intense.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If this is the way all the Gellers flirt, we don’t have a problem.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey uh, y’know that smell gas has?

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Yeah.
content.parenthetical: wanting more than anything to get the money and leave this horrible, horrible place

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: They put that in.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The gas is odorless, but they add the smell so you know when there’s a leak.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Well okay!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A lot of other gas smells…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh the humanity.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Meth-methane smells…

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Y’know what umm, actually I, I really, I should go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh but I-I-I haven’t paid you yet!

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Y’know what? That’s okay, you guys have ordered so many that this one is on me! (Runs for her life.)
(Ross closes the door slowly.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Was I talking to her about gas?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: More so than anything else.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I-I found it interesting.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, no-no, hey, hey, don’t worry about it! In nine years, she and I will be right there. (Goes and sits on the couch dejectedly.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, well, I’m gonna clear out some of these boxes. (She grabs a couple of the old pizza boxes and exits.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What else do they add smell too?

content.description: The street outside the building, Rachel is running to catch up with Caitlin.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Hey! (Stops Caitlin) Hi! Hey-hey-hey, I’m Rachel! From upstairs? The ones with all the pizza?

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Oh, is there a problem?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. No. Every thing’s—they’re fine. Great pizza. But it’s uh, actually umm my friend Ross. He uh, just gets really nervous when he’s flirting.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Oh my God! That was flirting?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, I know, but uh just, I’m telling you, once, once you get past that part, that where it-it just feels like you wanna die, he’s-he’s really a good person.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: The guy with the gas?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. I’m-I’m telling you he’s really sweet and he’s really funny and he’s just ugh, got a good heart. And besides, I y’know, I think he really likes you.

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well y’know, we have 7 people and like 10 pizzas, what do you think?

content.speaker: Caitlin
content.text: I just, I thought Joey was there.

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey’s grandmother are still watching Law & Order.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Ross? Umm, I just ran into Caitlin in the hallway and-and uh, you must be getting better at this flirting stuff than I thought.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I don’t get it, but she wanted me to give you her phone number. (Hands him the slip of paper with the phone number on it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And she just gave you this?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, thanks but uh, I don’t need you doing me any favors.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I-I-I didn’t! I didn’t! She thought you were cute.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well that I can believe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yay!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Is the show still on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Almost over man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look! Oh! (Pointing out the window.) Is that the Pope?! (Chandler and his grandma turn to look and Joey slips a tape into the VCR.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why am I looking?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, here I am, here’s my big scene!
(Joey has made a little home movie that’s his big scene. He braces himself against the door to his apartment and while holding a plastic gun and wearing the same sweater says…)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right back off! I gotta gun! I’m not afraid to use it!

content.speaker: Grandma Tribbiani
content.text: Oh Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You couldn’t have at least changed your shirt.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now, I wanna a suitcase filled with 100,000 dollars. (The duck quacks, to the duck) Choo! Choo! Choo! (To the imaginary cops) Filled with $100,000 in small bills, and if I don’t get it…(the duck quacks louder) Choo!! And if I don’t get it, (pause, picks up the duck) I’m gonna shoot this duck!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m comin’ out! (He opens the door and hops out pointing the gun in all directions and then runs out of view.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And she’s supposed to buy this?!

content.speaker: Grandma Tribbiani
content.text: Joey, bravo! (Starts with that Italian stuff again.)
(Suddenly, the tape cuts away from Joey’s impromptu scene, to Chandler standing really, really close to the camera.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ground control to Major Tom ! Commencing countdown…engines…on !
(Joey and Chandler both run to shut off the tape.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s uh, scenes from next week’s show. Next week’s!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I am definitely gonna watch that!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, another time lapse, Monica is seeking advice from Rachel and Phoebe about possible replacement earrings.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What about these? These look the same?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Definitely!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not as each other!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, then no.
(Goes over to Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You ready?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You look amazing. I’m the luckiest man in the world.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, you’re about to get a little luckier.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let me see the earrings.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, honey, the earrings…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They look great! Does your boyfriend have the best taste or what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My boyfriend really does have good taste!
(He turns to get his coat and Monica gives Rachel and Phoebe two thumbs up as Chandler walks over to Ross.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks for picking out the earrings man.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hm-mmm.
